column4: ever since I've upgraded to 11.04, my system just hangs at times when I'm opening a heavy page e.g. the Nike store's flash website. Just now, I ran a game and it was stuck so I had to unplug my computer then. My system has a NVidia card and while it worked fine on 10.10, it says it's NOT ACTIVE in 11.04
you have to enable third party drivers
go to "Additional Drivers" in your system menu
how do I do that? I have the driver downloaded but it says it's not active and there's no option to do so unlike 10.10
first you learn to read. the answer is ^^
I read properly but despite the driver downloaded, it says "ACTIVE BUT NOT IN USE"
YOU GO TO "ADDITIONAL DRIVERS" IN SYSTEM AND INSTALL IT THAT WAY
I have done it that way. It says ACTIVE BUT NOT IN USE. Do you get that?
did you enable third party drivers thru additional drivers.. its a checkbox or something
GEForce GO 7400 on a DV6000 HP.
hrmmmm.... sorry, cant help. sign the peition to have nvidia provice its own linus drivers....
can you please help me out? My system is unusable :(
